head.title: Y.& R. Loses a Chief And Names Another

hedline.hl1: Y.& R. Loses a Chief And Names Another

abstract.p: J Steve Davis will leave Young & Rubicam after eight months as president and chief executive of New York office; will be succeeded by executive vice president Linda J Srere (S)

block.p: Young & Rubicam Advertising said unexpectedly yesterday that J. Steve Davis would leave after only eight months as president and chief executive of its New York office. The executive promoted to succeed him, effective immediately, was Linda J. Srere, executive vice president, business development director and group managing director for that office.

Edward H. Vick, chairman and chief executive at Y.& R. Advertising, said Mr. Davis's departure was ''amicable.'' Mr. Davis, 51, said in a statement that he planned ''to identify other opportunities within the advertising business.''

Young & Rubicam Advertising said unexpectedly yesterday that J. Steve Davis would leave after only eight months as president and chief executive of its New York office. The executive promoted to succeed him, effective immediately, was Linda J. Srere, executive vice president, business development director and group managing director for that office.

Edward H. Vick, chairman and chief executive at Y.& R. Advertising, said Mr. Davis's departure was ''amicable.'' Mr. Davis, 51, said in a statement that he planned ''to identify other opportunities within the advertising business.''
Mr. Davis joined Y.& R. New York in May from J. Walter Thompson Chicago, part of WPP Group. Ms. Srere, 41, joined Y.& R. New York in 1994 from the New York office of Earle Palmer Brown.
